title: "MlflowException: API request to http://mlflow:5000/api/2.0/mlflow/experiments/create failed to return code 200 after 3 tries" on docker container

labels.name: area/tracking
labels.description: Tracking service, tracking client APIs, autologging

labels.name: priority/awaiting-more-evidence
labels.description: Lowest priority. Possibly useful, but not yet enough support to actually get it done.

body:
### System information - Have I written custom code (as opposed to using a stock example script provided in MLflow) - OS Platform and Distribution (e.g., Linux Ubuntu 16.04): Linut Mint 19.3 - MLflow version (run mlflow --version): 1.3.0 and 1.7.2 - Python version: 3.7.7 - Exact command to reproduce: ### Describe the problem: I'm have 3 dockers containers running: Jupyter, MLflow and min.io. My MLFLOW_TRACKING_URI is set to http://mlflow:5000, and I'm running the following snippet: `experiment = 'iris_classification' mlflow.set_tracking_uri(os.environ["MLFLOW_TRACKING_URI"]) mlflow.set_experiment(experiment)` With this output: > 2020/04/09 00:52:12 ERROR mlflow.utils.rest_utils: API request to http://mlflow:5000/api/2.0/mlflow/experiments/create failed with code 500 != 200, retrying up to 2 more times. API response body: > 500 Internal Server Error >

Internal Server Error

>

The server encountered an internal error and was unable to complete your request. Either the server is overloaded or there is an error in the application.

> > INFO: 'iris_classification' does not exist. Creating a new experiment > > 2020/04/09 00:52:15 ERROR mlflow.utils.rest_utils: API request to http://mlflow:5000/api/2.0/mlflow/experiments/create failed with code 500 != 200, retrying up to 1 more times. API response body: > 500 Internal Server Error >

Internal Server Error

>

The server encountered an internal error and was unable to complete your request. Either the server is overloaded or there is an error in the application.

> > 2020/04/09 00:52:18 ERROR mlflow.utils.rest_utils: API request to http://mlflow:5000/api/2.0/mlflow/experiments/create failed with code 500 != 200, retrying up to 0 more times. API response body: > 500 Internal Server Error >

Internal Server Error

>

The server encountered an internal error and was unable to complete your request. Either the server is overloaded or there is an error in the application.

> > --------------------------------------------------------------------------- > MlflowException Traceback (most recent call last) > in > 2 experiment = 'iris_classification' > 3 mlflow.set_tracking_uri(os.environ["MLFLOW_TRACKING_URI"]) > ----> 4 mlflow.set_experiment(experiment) > > /opt/conda/lib/python3.7/site-packages/mlflow/tracking/fluent.py in set_experiment(experiment_name) > 49 if exp_id is None: # id can be 0 > 50 print("INFO: '{}' does not exist. Creating a new experiment".format(experiment_name)) > ---> 51 exp_id = client.create_experiment(experiment_name) > 52 elif experiment.lifecycle_stage == LifecycleStage.DELETED: > 53 raise MlflowException( > > /opt/conda/lib/python3.7/site-packages/mlflow/tracking/client.py in create_experiment(self, name, artifact_location) > 159 :return: Integer ID of the created experiment. > 160 """ > --> 161 return self._tracking_client.create_experiment(name, artifact_location) > 162 > 163 def delete_experiment(self, experiment_id): > > /opt/conda/lib/python3.7/site-packages/mlflow/tracking/_tracking_service/client.py in create_experiment(self, name, artifact_location) > 126 return self.store.create_experiment( > 127 name=name, > --> 128 artifact_location=artifact_location, > 129 ) > 130 > > /opt/conda/lib/python3.7/site-packages/mlflow/store/tracking/rest_store.py in create_experiment(self, name, artifact_location) > 52 req_body = message_to_json(CreateExperiment( > 53 name=name, artifact_location=artifact_location)) > ---> 54 response_proto = self._call_endpoint(CreateExperiment, req_body) > 55 return response_proto.experiment_id > 56 > > /opt/conda/lib/python3.7/site-packages/mlflow/store/tracking/rest_store.py in _call_endpoint(self, api, json_body) > 30 endpoint, method = _METHOD_TO_INFO[api] > 31 response_proto = api.Response() > ---> 32 return call_endpoint(self.get_host_creds(), endpoint, method, json_body, response_proto) > 33 > 34 def list_experiments(self, view_type=ViewType.ACTIVE_ONLY): > > /opt/conda/lib/python3.7/site-packages/mlflow/utils/rest_utils.py in call_endpoint(host_creds, endpoint, method, json_body, response_proto) > 134 else: > 135 response = http_request( > --> 136 host_creds=host_creds, endpoint=endpoint, method=method, json=json_body) > 137 response = verify_rest_response(response, endpoint) > 138 js_dict = json.loads(response.text) > > /opt/conda/lib/python3.7/site-packages/mlflow/utils/rest_utils.py in http_request(host_creds, endpoint, retries, retry_interval, max_rate_limit_interval, **kwargs) > 78 time.sleep(retry_interval) > 79 raise MlflowException("API request to %s failed to return code 200 after %s tries" % > ---> 80 (url, retries)) > 81 > 82 > > MlflowException: API request to http://mlflow:5000/api/2.0/mlflow/experiments/create failed to return code 200 after 3 tries In case it helps, please find attached a zip file with my docker-compose.yml and Dockerfile: [docker-files.zip](https://github.com/mlflow/mlflow/files/4453451/docker-files.zip) I've searched through the relevant issues, but haven't found a solution (I've added EXPORT 5000 to the Dockerfile, and made sure MLFLOW_TRACKING_URI was properly set) Thanks for your time.
